alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 8:47AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Hancock Peanut Mill is affected in Courtland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Saturday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.7 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 05/24/1954. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 900 PM EST.
